info.description: HTTP requests for managing service accounts
info.title: Service Users API

get.summary: Get information about a service account
get.description: Returns information about the service account by its ID

400.description: Some request parameters are invalid or missing

parameters.name: tenant_id
parameters.description: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

delete.description: Deletes the service account by its ID

400.description: Some request parameters are invalid or missing

parameters.name: tenant_id
parameters.description: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

get.summary: Get the list of service accounts
get.description: Returns the list of all service accounts that belong to the specified VK Cloud user

400.description: Some request parameters are invalid or missing

parameters.name: tenant_id
parameters.description: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of the records in the list. Max: 200

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Sorting type. Possible values:

 ``NAME`` — sorting by the service account name

parameters.name: order_direction

post.description: Creates a new service account within the project

400.description: Some request parameters are invalid or missing

parameters.name: tenant_id
parameters.description: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

get.summary: Download the script to get authenticated as a service account
get.description: Returns an OpenStack RC file you can use to get authenticated as a service account

400.description: Some request parameters are invalid or missing

parameters.name: tenant_id
parameters.description: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

tenant_id.title: Value of the Project ID parameter for the project

role_names.description: List of roles of a service account. Possible values: ``mcs_co_owner`` — superadministrator ``mcs_admin`` — project administrator ``mcs_admin_security`` — user access administrator (IAM) ``mcs_admin_billing`` — billing administrator ``mcs_viewer`` — viewer; ``mcs_admin_vm`` — virtual machine administrator ``mcs_admin_vm_junior`` — junior VM administrator ``mcs_operator_vm`` — virtual machine operator ``mcs_admin_network`` — network administrator ``mcs_admin_network_security`` — network security administrator ``mcs_admin_network_objects`` — internal network administrator ``mcs_k8s_admin`` — Kubernetes administrator ``mcs_k8s_editor`` — Kubernetes operator ``mcs_k8s_viewer`` — Kubernetes auditor
role_names.title: List of roles of the service account

creator_name.title: Name of the VK Cloud user who created this service account

password.title: Generated password to be used for authentication

login.title: Service account login to be used for authentication

created_at.title: Date and time when the service account was created

OrderBy.description:
Sorting type. Possible values:

 ``NAME`` — sorting by the service account name

content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.
